primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God intervenes in a world of exhaustion and historical trauma to establish a 'new thing' that displaces the 'former things' (sin, guilt, death).

tekstueel_bewijs: God has spoken that word to us
Behold I am doing a new thing
God has acted in Jesus to give power
God has made a move toward new power
a newness they could not have imagined
a word from God addressed to the world

ontvanger.identificatie: The Disqualified (Blind, Lame, Leper, Dead, Poor)
tekstueel_bewijs: Christmas and the gospel reach toward folks exactly who are blind, lame, unclean, dead, poor
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer is explicitly invited to identify as the Receiver/Beneficiary.

helper.identificatie: Jesus / The Church / Global Justice Movements
tekstueel_bewijs: The church is the community that spots the newness
helper.rol_van_geest: External help manifested in historical events.

tegenstander.identificatie: Former Things / The Power of Death / Memory of Guilt
tekstueel_bewijs: old tapes and going over and over the old hurts
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is described as 'the power of death' and 'mortgages of eternity,' suggesting an ontological weight that humans cannot lift themselves.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The human response: Letting go of the past and 'seizing' the gift of newness.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Hearer
secundair_narratief_programma.object: Freedom from anger/guilt; Active participation in the new world.
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The human action (forgetting/seizing) is presented as a response to God's prior and decisive action (doing a new thing).

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.helper_subject_tegenstander: Jesus → God ← Power of Death/Former Things

voorbeelden_god_subject: God has declared a general amnesty

voorbeelden: Do not remember former things (presented as a release, not a law)
new power for life that enables
power and energy beyond our old handicaps

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on the endowment of 'Power' (Pouvoir) from God to an incompetent human subject. It is a 'can-do' theology rooted in divine gift rather than a 'must-do' legalism.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From S2 (Former things) to ~S2 (Forgetting) to S1 (Newness).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by God's 'decisive act' which renders S2 powerless.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; the 'former things' are described as crippling and death-dealing.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon consistently places God as the initiator of the 'New Thing.' Human action is framed as 'receiving' or 'seizing' what has already been established by God.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: you may take it, if you wish

indicatoren_genade.indicator: God as Subject of active verbs
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: God has declared a general amnesty
the power of death in your life

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Biblical figures (Isaiah's community, John the Baptist) are used as fellow-receivers of God's action, not as moral templates.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and empowerment; shifting from guilt to gratitude.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic start (God acts) with a synergistic response (Man seizes).

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the 'Primary Program' (God's act) to the 'Secondary Program' (Human response) is logically tight.
spanning_punten: The tension between 'God has done it' and 'You may decide to act'—the classic indicative/imperative tension.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: breaking up old forms of power... the power for death was broken

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The sermon emphasizes the 'gift of power' that enables the lame to walk.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is seen as an incapacitating force (leprosy, death, debt) that requires external rescue.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The narrative engine is driven by God as the Subject. The hearer is the Receiver of a new ontological status.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain current balance; it effectively counters legalism.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Soteriology (God's new thing) correctly precedes and empowers Ethics (seizing the newness).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This sermon is a masterclass in maintaining God as the Subject of the gospel story while inviting deep human participation without falling into moralism.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While rhetoric would focus on the 'This sermon is not for you' hook, semiotics reveals that this hook serves to define the 'Receiver' actant.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis would focus on the historical context of Isaiah 43; semiotics focuses on the functional role of 'Newness' as the Object.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas reveals that the sermon's power comes from the 'Subject-switch'—the hearer is too 'dead' to be the Subject, so God takes the role.

appendices.notities: The sermon uses political examples (Poland, South Africa) as 'Helpers' or signs of the Subject's (God's) activity in the world.
